column1: Mongolian Beef from the Slow Cooker,"1/4 cup cornstarch
","Spread cornstarch into a wide, shallow bowl. Dredge flank steak in the cornstarch to coat completely
column2: put into a large resealable plastic bag.n

column1: Stir water, soy sauce, brown sugar, carrots, green onions, olive oil, garlic, and ginger together in a bowl
column2: pour into the bag with the beef and seal.n

column1: Put bag of marinating beef in the freezer until the day before you wish to prepare it.n
Remove bag from freezer and put bag into a bowl and place in refrigerator to thaw, at least 24 hours before you wish to prepare the beef.n
Empty bag into the crock of a slow cooker.n
Cook on High until the beef is tender, 2 to 3 hours. Alternately, you can cook this on Low for 4 to 5 hours.n
Fast-and-Fabulous Egg and Cottage Cheese Casserole,"cooking spray
","Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Prepare a 10x13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.n
Mix eggs, cottage cheese, Monterey Jack cheese, green chiles, butter, flour, bacon, and baking powder together in a large bowl

Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and continue baking until a toothpick inserted into the center of the casserole comes out clean, about 30 minutes more.n
Grilled Steelhead Trout,"1 lemon, sliced into thin rounds with the ends reserved
salt and ground black pepper to taste
","Lightly oil the grate of your grill. Arrange lemon slices on the grate so they overlap slightly and form a shape slightly larger than your trout fillet.n
Preheat grill for medium heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).n
Heat olive oil in a small skillet over medium-high heat.n
Saute garlic and onion in the hot oil until the garlic browns slightly, 2 to 3 minutes
column2: season with salt and pepper. Squeeze the reserved lemon ends over the garlic mixture.n

column1: Gently lay the trout fillet onto the lemons with the skin side down. Brush the garlic mixture over the top of the fish.n
Cook trout on hot grill until the fish flesh flakes easily with a fork, about 10 minutes.n
1 teaspoon vegetable oil, or as needed
salt and ground black pepper to taste
","Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Crumble bacon pieces.n
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add asparagus and cook until tender yet firm to the bite, 2 to 3 minutes. Drain.n
Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
column2: saute onion, tomato, and mushrooms until tender, about 5 minutes.n

column1: Whisk eggs and cream together in a bowl
column2: add bacon, sauteed vegetables, asparagus, nutmeg, salt, and pepper.n

column1: Pour egg mixture into an oven-proof nonstick skillet and cover skillet. Cook over medium-low until cooked through, 10 to 12 minutes. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over omelette.n
Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.n
Broil omelette in the preheated oven until a golden crust starts to form on the top, about 2 minutes.n
Orange Pancakes,"2 cups white whole wheat flour
","Whisk flour, baking powder, and flax meal together in a bowl
column2: stir orange juice and orange extract into flour mixture until batter is well-combined.n

column1: Heat a lightly oiled griddle over medium-high heat, or an electric griddle to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Drop batter by large spoonfuls onto the griddle and cook until bubbles form and the edges are dry, 3 to 4 minutes. Flip and cook until browned on the other side, 2 to 3 minutes. Repeat with remaining batter.n
Oatmeal Energy Bars,"1 1/3 cups rolled oats
","Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a 9x11-inch baking dish with aluminum foil.n
Whisk oats, flour, chocolate chips, ground cashews, sunflower seeds, flax meal, wheat germ, cinnamon, and sea salt together in a large shallow bowl.n
Stir warmed honey, almond butter, and vanilla extract together in a bowl until well-mixed. Pour honey mixture into oat mixture
column2: stir until batter is well-combined. Turn batter out into prepared baking dish. Lay a sheet of waxed paper over batter and press firmly to evenly distribute in the baking dish. Remove and discard waxed paper.n

column1: Bake in the preheated oven until golden and fragrant, about 12 minutes. Pull aluminum foil from baking dish and cool bars in the aluminum foil for 10 minutes
column2: remove and discard aluminum foil. Cut into bars.n

column1: Vegan Lemon-Orange Pecan-Almond Hemp-Chia Ginger-Cardamom Scones,"1 orange, zested and juiced
1/2 cup cold coconut oil, divided into 8 equal-size pieces
","Preheat convection oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.n
Stir orange juice and lemon juice together in a small bowl
column2: add enough water, if necessary, to equal 7 tablespoons liquid.n

column1: Stir juice mixture, coconut milk, orange zest, lemon zest, chia seeds, and vanilla extract together in a bowl
column2: set aside until chia seeds gel, about 10 minutes.n

column1: Combine flour, sugar, baking soda, ginger, cardamom, and salt in the bowl of a food processor
column2: pulse until just-combined. Add cold coconut oil pieces and process until mixture resembles wet sand. Pour chia mixture into flour mixture
column3: pulse until dough begins to come together.n

column1: Transfer dough to a bowl and add pecans, almonds, and hemp
column2: knead with your hands until nuts and seeds are evenly distributed. Divide dough into 2 pieces, and flatten each piece into a 1-inch thick disc. Cut each disc into 8 wedges, and places wedges on prepared baking sheets.n

column1: Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when pressed, 30 to 35 minutes.n
Steel Cut Oats with Blueberries and Lemon Zest,"1 1/2 cups vanilla-flavored cultured coconut milk
","Stir coconut milk, oats, chia seeds, lemon zest, and vanilla extract together in a bowl. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate, 8 hours to overnight.n
Heat oats mixture in the microwave until warmed-through, about 1 minute. Top with blueberries.n
Vegan Orange Chocolate Oatmeal Muffins,"2 cups all-purpose flour
2 (8.25 ounce) cans mandarin orange segments, drained, liquid reserved
","Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper muffin liners.n
Whisk flour, sugar, oats, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl.n
Measure out 1 cup of reserved mandarin orange liquid
column2: add liquid and vegetable oil to flour mixture and stir until batter is well-combined. Fold oranges and chocolate chips into batter. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups.n

column1: Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 25 minutes.n
","Whisk flour, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl. Slowly pour milk into flour mixture, stirring constantly until dough is stiff and holds together.n
